intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. atrovariegatus, commonly known as the black-eyed bean, is a cultivated variety of the common bean. It is characterized by its dark green pods with a distinctive black eye spot near the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, oval-shaped seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and is often used in traditional cuisines.
